alert.note: Alert for Columbus; Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Robeson, northwestern Columbus, Florence, northern Georgetown, Dillon, Darlington, western Horry, Marion, southern Marlboro and eastern Williamsburg Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Darlington, Florence, and Nichols, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Florence, Conway, Hartsville, Marion, Dillon, Darlington, Mullins, Horry, Fairmont, Tabor City, Loris, Timmonsville, Chadbourn, Johnsonville, Latta, Pamplico, Rowland, Lamar, Fair Bluff and Quinby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 125 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 148 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 10. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
